poem:
### The New Gospel

In the bright temple  
of numbers, a man  
reshapes the clay  
of virtue, fingers smudging  
the lines between blessing  
and banality. Here,  
in this sacred byte,  
he preaches change  
with wires and wires—  
all prayers sent  
through the hollow,  
cold circuits of new  
gods, blessing the faithful.
